comments.body: Half heart with leather, one heart with chain and gold, two for iron, three for diamond, and four for netherite, or perhaps a specialized helmet enchantment that reduces the damage from stalactites by a certain amount.

It appears there is a similar post on this idea already being talked about! Help your ideas make it into Minecraft and join existing threads in progress, even if your idea isn't an exact match - we read ALL the comments. Don't forget to upvote good comments!

Maybe certain pieces of pottery could drastically increase the chance of getting a certain enchantment, such as a ceramic shard with a creeper carved on it increasing the chance to get Blast Protection.
I'm here from reddit, hope this explodes
This is a good idea but I feel pottery could link with enchantments in more ways than the ones you listed like special enchantment color and stuff

This idea is really good honestly maybe instead of losing it's signal the moment you step off it it slowly loses its redstone signal going down by say 1 every 4-8 ticks maybe differing based of oxidation if it can be oxidized.  Hope your idea gets more traction :)

In terms of decoration, lightning rods already make great table legs so being able to add a matching pressure plate on top would be nice for making builds more cohesive. I think it would be fine if, like the lightning rod, copper pressure plates didn't oxidize.

It's probably easier for the devs to add only one colour of pressure plate, so I think it's fine to have them never oxidize like lightning rods. However, to justify this, maybe the recipe to make them should require beeswax - as without being waxed the mechanism would rust and sieze up and therefore not work as a pressure plate.

Sorry if that was hard to understand on the fourth to last sentence. Here it is fixed: Also since it is considered a caves and cliffs suggestion what if there was an ancient structure or block in the mountains that could be activated to cause a new weather that might be otherworldly, unnatural, magical, or just different than the rest of the weather. I think that would be cool.

Weather would be great for an extra challenge to survival. Cold damage done at night in snowy biome unless you are wearing leather armor. A blindness effect in the desert from sand storms instead of rain. Maybe nausea is applied in jungles durning the day if you try running when your hunger is not full to represent the humidity. In caves humid weather could make stone slippery like ice. All of this opens up opportunities for new gear and potions to combat nature.

I like this idea since I also think rabbit hide is a good choice of material. I was thinking that maybe there could be a special structure in the plains or by a river where you can find a rabbit warren. You'd have to catch and breed some cuz there wouldnt be enough for five hides but it gives players another option than trekking to a desert.

Or you could make leatherworkers sell them. That's probably easiest since you still need leather and you could find one in any village.
If kangaroos are added they could give a special bundle or Pouch that can hold more items or have other unique features
rabbits should be found (uncommonly) in plains.
Or you could have rabbits have multiple babies like goats. (This isn't my idea, by the way.)
Rabbits having multiple babies will make them more viable for farming.

Ah yeah, the return of the "Swaggiest Stairs Ever!" XD

Netherite Stairs!

Of course. Let's also have Redstone armor because Redstone is an ore and therefore must also be a tier with tools and armor. Also, since Quartz is a gemstone, why not use it in armor like Diamonds? Also Emerald is a gemstone, so why not use it in decoration and have more building options for it like Quartz? In case you didn't notice; I'M BEING SARCASTIC! Mojang has been trying to convey to you that every ore needs to have a unique purpose, and any functionality that it has needs to be special and have a reason to exist! Not just because they're all metals does that mean that they all should be used for building! This has been the case in Minecraft a very long time; some minerals might share similar properties, but they shouldn't share too similar functionalities. Even with tiers, each tier needs to have a special reason to exist, like being a significant part of progression like Iron and Diamonds or Netherite, or having special properties that are actually useful.

yes Cut Iron + Gold variants please :D. with their own unique textures too, Iron could look more industrial while Gold could look more ornamental.

I'd like rusting iron too, but gold does not rust, like at all, there's no such thing. If Iron rusting were added, then existing iron blocks in worlds should probably be converted to waxed versions to avoid ruining already-existing player builds.

396386292072

Dude, chill. Copper Oxidizes, and that's pretty unique. Not to mention lightning rods... Every ore has a block variant, just because they want stairs for them is nothing to be upset about (plus, those would be crazy expensive to make in bulk anyways) :/

And I personally think Copper should have at least a few more uses than just exclusively building blocks... the update hasn't even come out yet, after all!

Lasercraft 32

Sorry, it just deeply hurts me when people make suggestions of that sort :/ First people would ask for block variants for other metals, and then believe me right away they would be asking for Diamond stairs. Besides this suggestions also suggests that Iron should oxidize like Copper. They've literally said before why they want the oxidation to be a Copper exclusive and not just happen with Iron as well, just like they've talked about why Copper and Emerald tiers are not a good idea. Each ore needs to have special properties, allowing you to do something unique and creative with it, not just a somewhat different version of what another ore can do. I'd even go as far as to say that Gold being a tier (or perhaps existing at all) was a mistake that they (mostly) fixed with the Nether Update. Before then when you first here about Gold, you go like "Wow, that is epic! It's a very precious metal! What can I do with it?". Not very much actually; the only real use are Golden Apples and maybe Golden Carrots and/or Glistening Melons.
copper blocks are supposed to be building blocks, but iron and gold are just for storage

Ever since I started playing Minecraft, I've been wishing for stairs, slabs, fences, trapdoors, etc. made of iron, gold, lapis, emerald, redstone, and coal. Maybe these wishes will come true someday. There would be such great new decadent design possibilities.

Decorative variants of the mineral/compressed ingot/ore blocks would be nice. It'd serve as a nice end-game flex block to show how much resources you have even if the swaggiest stair ever was just a joke. Remember coal blocks and stained glass? Those were from joke snapshot April fools updates and those were added to the main game due to being highly requested.

Since mineral blocks are already a storage block, like copper blocks once cut they cannot be turned back into the storage mineral block and are purely decorative meaning they can't be used in Beacon pyramids.

There should be details in the sky that you can only find when using the telescope. Maybe you can use the telescope to look at certain places in the night sky for special events. Special event areas will spawn (and despawn) randomly throughout the night sky. For example, if you stare directly at a "black hole" through a spyglass, Phantoms will spawn. Phantoms are known as the Monster of the Night Skies after all.
This would be a nice little aesthetic thing. Additionally, this would lead to the spyglass becoming incredibly useful when Minecraft one day far in the future makes it to space.
Yes! maybe depending on how many stars are visible will effect how many mobs will spawn.
I really really love this idea, it reminds me of some kind of enchanted forest. It would be cool if there was fairies or unicorns or some other kind of magical creature.
I like this idea

There should be giant cyan mushrooms here too. They could be a different color, but I like the idea of giant mushrooms here. They would fit in perfectly with the mystic theme.

Great idea and way to give players a better and very appropriate fighting chance, when dealing with the Warden. Hopefully Mojang enjoys it as much as everyone else!

This is literally the solution for the painting problem. And actually CYCLE through the same size paintings, not pick one at random
would make sense and bring the rarely used effect more into the game
I would love to see this.
Maybe eating them gives it to you for a very short time, and you could brew them into a potion of glowing to get the effect for a longer duration.
Or you could use them to craft Spectral Arrows?  I know glowstone is pretty easy to get, but this would be an easy, mid-game way to get some of the more unique weapons.
this just makes sense

Eating glow berries could also be used to make a potion that when drank give the glow effect to the closest 5 (or so) hostile mobs in a range around you (like a bell), You could increase the range or the amount of mobs with growstone. This would allow for a way to find caves and dark spots and give a new use to glow berries.

yeah, just for a few seconds even, it'd kind of be an overworld parallel to chorus fruit too! 

also, it could just have the chance to give you the glowing effect, like raw chicken and hunger, or poisonous potatoes and poison.

Yea, coal should be extra common in swamps because coal is formed by peat and other plant matter which is very abundant in swamps. Also copper should be extra common in oceans to explain why the drowned drop it.

no coal should be extra common in the desert not in the swamps, as deserts did the "plant-to-coal cycle".T hat is why they have no vegetation, while swamps didn't do the "plant-to-coal cycle" and that s why there are so many plants in there
Coooooool this is perfect they sound like Jedi from star wars, sworn to protect all life no matter what . I hope this gets added .

Good idea, just a few changes/suggestions.

They should only be passive to passive mobs, NPCs, and iron golems. They'll attack all hostile mobs on sight, as well as a few "monster" neutral mobs. They're guardians, so they should attack players if players attack them. Maybe they barter mob loot like half a stack of rotten flesh or maybe 10 gunpowder or something like that for stone and cobblestone (to heal them). Yes, and they only have one weakness: they're scared of water, so they have to leave the drowned to the axolotls.
makes sense
